intro: Hernandia leucomphala, commonly known as white-leaf hernandia, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically white or pale green in color, a striking feature that distinguishes it from other members of its genus.
